meanings.definition: A horse race or boxing match in which one contestant has no competitors.
meanings.sent1: The horse race was a walkovers with only one participant.
meanings.sent2: The boxing match was declared a walkovers due to the lack of opponents.
meanings.sent3: The horse race became a walkovers when all other horses dropped out.
meanings.sent4: The boxing match felt like a walkovers as the fighter entered the ring alone.
meanings.sent5: The walkovers event had the crowd cheering for the lone competitor.

meanings.definition: To win easily or without effort.
meanings.sent1: She walkovers the competition with her exceptional skills.
meanings.sent2: The team walkovers their opponents in the final game of the season.
meanings.sent3: He walkovers the video game level in just a few minutes.
meanings.sent4: The company walkovers the market with their innovative product.
meanings.sent5: The student walkovers the exam after studying all night.
